abstract: Union officials say the company, the producer of such brands as Twinkies and Wonder Bread, has indicated it will proceed with plans to liquidate.
snippet: Union officials say the company, the producer of such brands as Twinkies and Wonder Bread, has indicated it will proceed with plans to liquidate.
lead_paragraph: Hostess Brands announced on Tuesday night that despite the help of a mediator, it had failed to reach a new labor agreement with the bakery workers union — and union officials said the company had indicated it would proceed with plans to liquidate.

headline.main: Hostess Brands Says It Fails to Reach Labor Deal in Mediation
headline.print_headline: After Failed Labor Talks, Hostess Nears Liquidation

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Bakery, Confectionery, Tobacco Workers and Grain Millers International Union

abstract: In granting Hostess’s motion, Judge Robert D. Drain of the Federal Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York cited the need for a quick and orderly shuttering of the company to avoid letting its assets molder.
snippet: In granting Hostess’s motion, Judge Robert D. Drain of the Federal Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York cited the need for a quick and orderly shuttering of the company to avoid letting its assets molder.
lead_paragraph: A federal bankruptcy judge on Wednesday approved plans for Hostess Brands to wind down its operations, but there is little doubt that its best-known brand, Twinkies, will live on.

byline.original: By Steven Greenhouse and Michael J. de la Merced
